newsitem.title: USA: Two letter bombs found at Saudi paper's U.S. office.
newsitem.headline: Two letter bombs found at Saudi paper's U.S. office.

text.p: Two letter bombs were recovered from the incoming mail to Al Hayat, a Saudi Arabian newspaper with offices at the National Press Club building in downtown Washington, police said on Thursday.

The first bomb was discovered by an employee of the newspaper "when he came across an envelope that he suspected to be a letter bomb," police said in a statement. The device "appeared to have all the components of a letter bomb."
City police officers who examined the first bomb discovered a second one as they went through the remainder of the newspaper's mail, the statement said.
Both bombs were removed from the site and safely detonated, police said, offering no further details.
Washington police and the FBI's Terrorist Task Force were investigating the case.
Al Hayat, a Saudi newspaper based in London, had published the manifesto of a radical Islamic group after the fatal June 25 bombing of U.S. military personnel in the Saudi city of Khobar.
The National Press Club building is the Washington home to many U.S. and foreign news organisations and is located about two blocks from the White House.
